alert.note: Alert for Northern Berkshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 18 at 3:39AM EDT until April 19 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches at elevations 1500 feet or greater in the southern Greens and northern Berkshires. Isolated amounts up to 8 inches are possible in the southern Greens. East to south east winds gusting as high as 35 to 45 mph tonight into Tuesday morning. * WHERE...In Vermont, Bennington and Western Windham Counties. In Massachusetts, Northern Berkshire County. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 11 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Some downed tree limbs and power outages are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates may briefly be an inch per hour early Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
